justification: The introduction states: "To assess anhedonia, validated tools such as the Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS) ... are commonly used," indicating SHAPS is a measurement instrument for anhedonia.

The same sentence notes that the Dimensional Anhedonia Rating Scale (DARS) is "a more recent tool" designed to provide a domain-specific assessment of anhedonia, confirming it is used to measure this construct.

Under Prescreening Results, participants were "pre-screened using ... the Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD)," and later the methods clarify that "participants completed the GAD-7, which measures anxiety," establishing GAD-7 as the anxiety measure.

The prescreening section lists the "Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale (ZUNG)" among the questionnaires and later notes that "the ZUNG was used to assess depressive symptoms," showing it is the instrument for measuring depression.
